RumorFact.Text: Slate asked me to hear out what questions the kids in the village have about the universe.

ExploreFact.Text: Mica says that sand hasn't been flowing between the Hourglass Twins for some time.
According to Chert, sand would start flowing between the Hourglass Twins again on the morning of my launch day, right as the sun rises over the horizon in the village.
Somehow, Chert knows exactly when sand flows between the Hourglass Twins.

RumorFact.Text: Slate asked me to hear out what questions the kids in the village have about the universe.
I used my Little Scout to look inside the drain behind the waterwheel, but the museum shard wasn't in there.
I jumped down a geyser into the underwater caves of Timber Hearth, but the museum shard wasn't in there.
Tephra asked me to explore the Nomai Ruins outside the village to see if the museum shard was traveling there. They warned me about ghost matter in that area.

ExploreFact.Text: Tephra and Galena noticed the quantum shard in the museum disappearing completely sometimes. They wondered where it went when it disappeared completely.
Tephra asked me to use my Little Scout to check if the museum shard was inside the drain behind the village waterwheel.

AltText.Text: I used my Little Scout to look inside the drain behind the waterwheel, but the museum shard wasn't in there.

ExploreFact.Text: Tephra asked me to dive into a geyser to see if the museum shard was inside the underwater caves of Timber Hearth.

AltText.Text: I jumped down a geyser into the underwater caves of Timber Hearth, but the museum shard wasn't in there.

ExploreFact.Text: According to Riebeck, our ancestors once lived in the ancient waterways inside Timber Hearth's geysers.
Arkose thinks Riebeck would lose their marbles if they heard about the Nomai mural I found in the waterways.
Tephra says that until we figure out another way to see where the museum shard goes, we've hit a dead end.

AltText.Text: Tephra asked me to explore the Nomai Ruins outside the village to see if the museum shard was traveling there. They asked me to be careful of ghost matter in that area.

RumorFact.Text: Slate asked me to hear out what questions the kids in the village have about the universe.
Galena says Feldspar told them about tentacled monsters on the surface of Giant's Deep.

ExploreFact.Text: Galena says Feldspar told them about monsters on Giant's Deep.
According to Feldspar, the monsters on Giant's Deep would come to the surface of the ocean sometimes.

RumorFact.Text: Slate asked me to hear out what questions the kids in the village have about the universe.
Arkose says that Gabbro was the one who told them that ghost matter disappears.

ExploreFact.Text: Arkose noticed that the patch of ghost matter in the village wouldn't leave a glowing trail sometimes when a rock was thrown into it.
According to Gabbro, ghost matter disappears sometimes.
Gabbro asked me to tell Arkose about how water neutralizes ghost matter.

RumorFact.Text: Slate asked me to hear out what questions the kids in the village have about the universe.

ExploreFact.Text: For some reason, Moraine asked me how many comets there were in the star system.
Moraine says they saw two comets in the sky one night. They were sure it was a second comet, but they haven't been able to find it again since.

RumorFact.Text: My Little Scout traveled with the museumâ€™s quantum shard into a glittering cave somewhere within Timber Hearth.
The Nomai built the Sanctuary in a cave within Timber Hearth's underground pools where a quantum shard traveled.
Ore mined on Timber Hearth was treated at a forge on Hollow's Lantern before being used to reinforce the Sanctuary.
The Nomai planned to use a new invention from the Scroll and Stone Workshop to enter the Sanctuary.
The Nomai reported trouble of some kind at the Sanctuary.

AltText.Text: Several of the native species inside the Sanctuary eluded the Nomai's attempts to release them back to the surface.

RumorFact.Text: The Hearthians that survived the arrival of ghost matter within the Sanctuary were quarantined inside by a Nomai named Cassava.

ExploreFact.Text: A Sanctuary built to protect the native lifeforms of Timber Hearth during the operation of the Ash Twin Project.

AltText.Text: A Sanctuary built in Timber Hearth's underground pools to protect the native lifeforms of Timber Hearth during the operation of the Ash Twin Project.

ExploreFact.Text: The native species of Timber Hearth were endangered by some sort of danger because of their amphibious nature. A Nomai named Cassava quarantined the surviving species left inside the Sanctuary.

AltText.Text: The native species of Timber Hearth were endangered by ghost matter because of their amphibious nature. A Nomai named Cassava quarantined the surviving species left inside the Sanctuary.

ExploreFact.Text: A quantum shard escaped a Nomai's sight when the Nomai accidentally disconnected from his voyager. Another Nomai reminded him that voyagers were able to use the rule of quantum entanglement.
"A voyager is unable to observe its surroundings on its own."

RumorFact.Text: There is a Nomai campsite on the path from the Nomai Ruins into the geyser mountain.

ExploreFact.Text: This campsite belonged to the Nomai working on Timber Hearth.
The Nomai constructed something called the Sanctuary within Timber Hearth's underground pools, in a cave visited by a quantum shard.
A new invention from the Scroll and Stone Workshop allowed Nomai to freely use the rule of quantum entanglement.
The Nomai discovered a new species during an expedition to Timber Hearth, and followed it deeper into the mountain.
I found Nomai text warning of danger invisible to the naked eye beyond a thorny barricade.

RumorFact.Text: A Nomai named Cassava traveled to Timber Hearth to study another property of ghost matter he noticed.
A Nomai named Cassava observed ghost matter in this site being pulled up by the Attlerockâ€™s gravity as it orbited overhead.

ExploreFact.Text: There is a scroll in a toppled shelf here, but it is surrounded by ghost matter.

AltText.Text: A Nomai named Cassava observed ghost matter in this site being pulled up by the Attlerockâ€™s gravity as it orbited overhead. He posited that ghost matter could be competitively manipulated by sources of gravity.

ExploreFact.Text: This discovery was named the property of attraction.
The Nomai on Timber Hearth were careful not to leave this warp receiver unattended, to protect the planet's native life from being warped to Ash Twin.
After a Nomai has warped to it and the warp pad is clear of any entities, a warp receiver powers a return warp that allows travel to its paired warp transmitter once.
